alert.note: Alert for Kent; New Castle; Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 6:58PM EDT until August 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Sussex County in southern Delaware... South central New Castle County in northern Delaware... Kent County in central Delaware... Talbot County in eastern Maryland... Queen Anne`s County in northeastern Maryland... Caroline County in eastern Maryland... Central Kent County in northeastern Maryland... Southeastern Camden County in southern New Jersey... Atlantic County in southern New Jersey... Cumberland County in southern New Jersey... Southern Salem County in southern New Jersey... Southeastern Gloucester County in southern New Jersey... Northwestern Cape May County in southern New Jersey... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 657 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Woodland Beach to near Sudlersville to near Stevensville to Romancoke to near Golden Beach, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Vineland, Dover, Millville, Bridgeton, Easton, Centerville, Cumberland, Talbot, Hammonton, Smyrna, Milford, Buena, Denton, Centreville, Egg Harbor City, Laurel Lake, Harrington, Camden, Clayton and Federalsburg. This includes Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 11 and 32. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central, northern and southern Delaware...eastern and northeastern Maryland... and southern New Jersey. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central, northern and southern Delaware...eastern and northeastern Maryland... and southern New Jersey.
